module_restrictions: Exchange students can choose CCs in the Core Programme and/or elective major specialties provided that the courses taken are effectively taught (and taken) during the appropriate semester and that the choice is compatible with the overall university course schedules. The final choice must be approved by both the 'home' and the 'host' universities.
visa_info: Long-Stay visas are necessary for stays exceeding 3 months. Upon arrival in France, students are required to register with the French Immigration and Integration Office (OFII) for a residence permit. Please visit the websites of French embassies and consulates in your country. All students who wish to study in France must follow the Campus France procedure on Etudes en France online platform before applying for a visa. Students can apply up to 3 months prior to the departure. For more information about visa, please refer to http://www.ambafrance-sg.org/-English- or https://www.utc.fr/en/international/studying-at-utc/exchange-students/getting-ready-for-a-stay-in-france.html
accommodations_info: There are two types of accommodation available: student residences managed by the French government (CROUS) and private residences. Student residences are generally situated at a walking distance from the campus facilities and academic departments. Students who wish to stay in the student residence must contact the international office by sending an email to sadia.baiche@utc.fr. For more information on accommodation, please refer to https://www.utc.fr/en/international/studying-at-utc/exchange-students/getting-ready-for-a-stay-in-france.html
cost_of_living:
The estimated monthly living expenses in France are as follows:

- Accommodation: €600
- Food: €290
- Transport: €50 - €100
- Others (Entertainment, clothes): €100 - €120

Monthly Estimate: €1,040 - €1,110

Details can be found at https://www.utc.fr/en/international/studying-at-utc/exchange-students/getting-ready-for-a-stay-in-france.html (Under the “Cost of life” tab)
